synopsis: In this episode, we meet Suguri and her chance encounter with Kappi on a bridge.
If you're Suguri and Kappi, how would you go after a lost bird?  How about a flying lollipop?
In this episode, Kappi tries to help out with the cleaning in various ways.
In this episode, Kappi goes out to the park.  He was asked to stay quiet, but his stomach and his love for donuts spell quite an adventure.
If you're Kappi and you have the choice between donuts and traditional Japanese confections, but choosing one will alienate a friend, what would you do?
In this episode, we introduce Dokuroppi, Kappi's "friend".
In this episode, Dokuroppi actually is helpful and nice in many ways.
In  this episode Suguri makes a present for Kappi.  However, what else is really going on and who is giving what to whom?
In this episode, we introduce Whippi.  Her relatively short visit is rather exciting (and rather troublesome).
In this episode, Suguri gets a taste of what it is like to be an adult.
In this episode, we introduce Kobara, Kappi's little sister.  Unfortunately, Suguri finds out really quickly that Kobara is a kleptomaniac, and the way she steals things usually will not go her way.
In this episode, we explore what Kappi would do when he takes shelter from the rain and takes a cat under his wing.
Imagine the sheer chaos when everyone from Kappimeshia shows up at Suguri's home!
In this episode, Suguri's attempt to disguise Kappi as a talking stuffed animal backfires, and Kappi's magic allows Suguri to bypass construction on the bridge.
In this episode, Whippi manages to throw Suguri's bracelet out the window, where it gets picked up by various animals in the area.
In this episode, Suguri and Kappi make a wedding anniversary into something very memorable.
In this episode, the family goes camping.  However, when Kappi eats spicy things such as curry, things go completely topsy-turvy.

This episode is a continuation of the previous episode.  Apparently in this camping area there is a Kappimeshian treasure buried here... and Whippi and Kobara are trying to find it when they run into Suguri, Kappi, and Dokuroppi.
In this episode, Suguri, An, and Kappi experience the wonders of being tiny.
In this episode, Suguri and Kappi play matchmaker.
Most likely everyone is familiar with the phrase "too many cooks spoil the soup".  In this episode, you can correct this to "too many capybaras and magic spoil the cake".

This episode of Happy Kappi is about as close as you'll probably get to something that resembles the Twilight Zone in strangeness.  In this episode, Suguri, Kappi, and Whippi end up getting trapped in a magical sphere of memories.
In this episode, Suguri and Kappi get into a dispute over something that adults would consider trivial.

In this episode, Kappi is suddenly unable to do magic.  On top of that, he has been summoned back to Kappimeshia.  Will Suguri be able to get her favorite accessory to him before he is sucked into the portal?
